info.title: thirdweb Engine
info.description: Engine is an open-source, backend server that reads, writes, and deploys contracts at production scale.

post.description: Create a backend wallet.

isTestnet.description: If your engine is configured with a testnet API Key for Circle, you can only create testnet wallets and send testnet transactions. Enable this field for testnet wallets. NOTE: A production API Key cannot be used for testnet transactions, and a testnet API Key cannot be used for production transactions. See: https://developers.circle.com/w3s/sandbox-vs-production

post.description: Transfer native currency or ERC20 tokens to another wallet.

currencyAddress.description: The token address to transfer. Omit to transfer the chain's native currency (e.g. ETH on Ethereum).

amount.description: The amount in ether to transfer. Example: "0.1" to send 0.1 ETH.

gasPrice.description: Gas price for the transaction. Do not use this if maxFeePerGas is set or if you want to use EIP-1559 type transactions. Only use this if you want to use legacy transactions.

timeoutSeconds.description: Maximum duration that a transaction is valid. If a transaction cannot be sent before the timeout, the transaction will be set to 'errored'. Default: no timeout

value.description: Amount of native currency in wei to send with this transaction. Used to transfer funds or pay a contract.

parameters.name: simulateTx
parameters.description: Simulates the transaction before adding it to the queue, returning an error if it fails simulation. Note: This step is less performant and recommended only for debugging purposes.

parameters.name: chain
parameters.description: A chain ID ("137") or slug ("polygon-amoy-testnet"). Chain ID is preferred.

parameters.name: x-backend-wallet-address
parameters.description: Backend wallet address

parameters.name: x-idempotency-key
parameters.description: Transactions submitted with the same idempotency key will be de-duplicated. Only the last 100000 transactions are compared.

parameters.name: x-transaction-mode
parameters.description: Transaction mode to use for EOA transactions. Will be ignored if using a smart wallet. If omitted, defaults to regular EOA transactions.

parameters.name: x-account-factory-address
parameters.description: Smart account factory address. If omitted, Engine will try to resolve it from the contract.

parameters.name: x-account-salt
parameters.description: Smart account salt as string or hex. This is used to predict the smart account address. Useful when creating multiple accounts with the same admin and only needed when deploying the account as part of a userop.

post.description: Cancel all nonces up to the provided nonce. This is useful to unblock a backend wallet that has transactions waiting for nonces to be mined.

toNonce.description: The nonce to cancel up to, inclusive. Example: If the onchain nonce is 10 and 'toNonce' is 15, this request will cancel nonces: 11, 12, 13, 14, 15

timeoutSeconds.description: Maximum duration that a transaction is valid. If a transaction cannot be sent before the timeout, the transaction will be set to 'errored'. Default: no timeout

value.description: Amount of native currency in wei to send with this transaction. Used to transfer funds or pay a contract.

parameters.name: chain
parameters.description: A chain ID ("137") or slug ("polygon-amoy-testnet"). Chain ID is preferred.

parameters.name: x-backend-wallet-address
parameters.description: Backend wallet address

parameters.name: x-idempotency-key
parameters.description: Transactions submitted with the same idempotency key will be de-duplicated. Only the last 100000 transactions are compared.

parameters.name: x-transaction-mode
parameters.description: Transaction mode to use for EOA transactions. Will be ignored if using a smart wallet. If omitted, defaults to regular EOA transactions.

parameters.name: x-account-address
parameters.description: Smart account address

parameters.name: x-account-factory-address
parameters.description: Smart account factory address. If omitted, Engine will try to resolve it from the contract.

parameters.name: x-account-salt
parameters.description: Smart account salt as string or hex. This is used to predict the smart account address. Useful when creating multiple accounts with the same admin and only needed when deploying the account as part of a userop.

post.description: Generate a signature granting access for another wallet to mint tokens from this ERC-20 contract. This method is typically called by the token contract owner.

to.description: The wallet address that can use this signature to mint tokens. This is to prevent another wallet from intercepting the signature and using it to mint tokens for themselves.

quantity.description: The number of tokens this signature can be used to mint.

primarySaleRecipient.description: If a price is specified, the funds will be sent to the primarySaleRecipient address. Defaults to the primarySaleRecipient address of the contract.

uid.description:
A unique identifier for the payload, used to prevent replay attacks and other types of exploits.
      Note that the input value gets hashed in the actual payload that gets generated. 
      The smart contract enforces on-chain that no uid gets used more than once, 
      which means you can deterministically generate the uid to prevent specific exploits.

currencyAddress.description: The address of the currency to pay for minting the tokens (use the price field to specify the price). Defaults to NATIVE_TOKEN_ADDRESS

price.description: If you want the user to pay for minting the tokens, you can specify the price per token. Defaults to 0.

anyOf.description: The time until which the signature can be used to mint tokens. Defaults to 10 years from now.

post.description: Generate a signature granting access for another wallet to mint tokens from this ERC-721 contract. This method is typically called by the token contract owner.

to.description: The wallet address that can use this signature to mint tokens. This is to prevent another wallet from intercepting the signature and using it to mint tokens for themselves.

royaltyRecipient.description: The address that will receive the royalty fees from secondary sales. Defaults to the royaltyRecipient address of the contract.

quantity.description: The number of tokens this signature can be used to mint.

royaltyBps.description: The percentage fee you want to charge for secondary sales. Defaults to the royaltyBps of the contract.

primarySaleRecipient.description: If a price is specified, the funds will be sent to the primarySaleRecipient address. Defaults to the primarySaleRecipient address of the contract.

uid.description:
A unique identifier for the payload, used to prevent replay attacks and other types of exploits.
      Note that the input value gets hashed in the actual payload that gets generated. 
      The smart contract enforces on-chain that no uid gets used more than once, 
      which means you can deterministically generate the uid to prevent specific exploits.

anyOf.description: The time until which the signature can be used to mint tokens. Defaults to 10 years from now.

post.description: Update a single claim phase, by providing the index of the claim phase and the new phase configuration. The index is the position of the phase in the list of phases you have made, starting from zero. e.g. if you have two phases, the first phase has an index of 0 and the second phase has an index of 1. post.description: Mint ERC-1155 tokens from a generated signature.

to.description: The wallet address that can use this signature to mint tokens. This is to prevent another wallet from intercepting the signature and using it to mint tokens for themselves.

royaltyRecipient.description: The address that will receive the royalty fees from secondary sales. Defaults to the royaltyRecipient address of the contract.

quantity.description: The number of tokens this signature can be used to mint.

royaltyBps.description: The percentage fee you want to charge for secondary sales. Defaults to the royaltyBps of the contract.

primarySaleRecipient.description: If a price is specified, the funds will be sent to the primarySaleRecipient address. Defaults to the primarySaleRecipient address of the contract.

uid.description:
A unique identifier for the payload, used to prevent replay attacks and other types of exploits.
      Note that the input value gets hashed in the actual payload that gets generated. 
      The smart contract enforces on-chain that no uid gets used more than once, 
      which means you can deterministically generate the uid to prevent specific exploits.

external_url.description: The external url of the NFT

animation_url.description: The animation url of the NFT

background_color.description: The background color of the NFT

currencyAddress.description: The address of the currency to pay for minting the tokens (use the price field to specify the price). Defaults to NATIVE_TOKEN_ADDRESS

price.description: If you want the user to pay for minting the tokens, you can specify the price per token. Defaults to 0.

mintStartTime.description: The time from which the signature can be used to mint tokens. Defaults to now if value not provided.

mintEndTime.description: The time until which the signature can be used to mint tokens. Defaults to 10 years from now.

gasPrice.description: Gas price for the transaction. Do not use this if maxFeePerGas is set or if you want to use EIP-1559 type transactions. Only use this if you want to use legacy transactions.

post.summary: Overwrite the claim conditions for a specific token ID..
post.description: Overwrite the claim conditions for a specific token ID. All properties of a phase are optional, with the default being a free, open, unlimited claim, in the native currency, starting immediately.

tokenId.description: ID of the token to set the claim conditions for

gasPrice.description: Gas price for the transaction. Do not use this if maxFeePerGas is set or if you want to use EIP-1559 type transactions. Only use this if you want to use legacy transactions.

timeoutSeconds.description: Maximum duration that a transaction is valid. If a transaction cannot be sent before the timeout, the transaction will be set to 'errored'. Default: no timeout

value.description: Amount of native currency in wei to send with this transaction. Used to transfer funds or pay a contract.

parameters.name: simulateTx
parameters.description: Simulates the transaction before adding it to the queue, returning an error if it fails simulation. Note: This step is less performant and recommended only for debugging purposes.

parameters.name: chain
parameters.description: A chain ID ("137") or slug ("polygon-amoy-testnet"). Chain ID is preferred.

parameters.name: contractAddress
parameters.description: Contract address

parameters.name: x-backend-wallet-address
parameters.description: Backend wallet address

parameters.name: x-idempotency-key
parameters.description: Transactions submitted with the same idempotency key will be de-duplicated. Only the last 100000 transactions are compared.

parameters.name: x-transaction-mode
parameters.description: Transaction mode to use for EOA transactions. Will be ignored if using a smart wallet. If omitted, defaults to regular EOA transactions.

parameters.name: x-account-address
parameters.description: Smart account address

parameters.name: x-account-factory-address
parameters.description: Smart account factory address. If omitted, Engine will try to resolve it from the contract.

parameters.name: x-account-salt
parameters.description: Smart account salt as string or hex. This is used to predict the smart account address. Useful when creating multiple accounts with the same admin and only needed when deploying the account as part of a userop.

error.message: Transaction not found with queueId 9eb88b00-f04f-409b-9df7-7dcc9003bc35

get.description:
Get the basis points of the bid buffer. 
This is the percentage higher that a new bid must be than the current highest bid in order to be placed. 
If there is no current bid, the bid must be at least the minimum bid amount.
Returns the value in percentage format, e.g. 100 = 1%.

parameters.name: listingId
parameters.description: The id of the listing to retrieve.

parameters.name: chain
parameters.description: A chain ID ("137") or slug ("polygon-amoy-testnet"). Chain ID is preferred.

parameters.name: contractAddress
parameters.description: Contract address

result.description: Returns a number representing the basis points of the bid buffer.

get.description:
Helper function to calculate the value that the next bid must be in order to be accepted. 
If there is no current bid, the bid must be at least the minimum bid amount.
If there is a current bid, the bid must be at least the current bid amount + the bid buffer.
